description: This command queries a list of domain addon log entries.
availability: All users have access to this command. This command only returns log entries for domain addons which the executing user owns.

paramaters.Definition: Filter by a specific addon ID. You can specify several addon IDs separated by a '/'. If no addon ID is specified all addon IDs of the addon class will be taken
Filter by a specific domain repository. You can specify several repositories separated by a '/'.
Filter by a specific domain name
Filter by a specific action.  Must be one of the following:  ACTIVATE, ADD_BLACKLIST, CONFIRM, UNCONFIRM, CREATE, UNCREATE, DEACTIVATE, DEL_BLACKLIST, CANCEL, DELETE, EXPIRE, PENDING, RENEW, COMMENT
Index of the first entry to be returned
Max. number of entries to be returned. The system has a default value for performance purposes

The parameter by which the output will be sorted. Must be one of the following:  CREATEDDATE, CREATEDDATEDESC, LOGDATE, LOGDATEDESC, OPERATIONTYPE, OPERATIONTYPEDESC, STATUS, STATUSDESC, DOMAIN, DOMAINDESC
Minimal date of the log entry
Maximal date of the log entry
The minimal age of the addon. Value has to be a dedicated number of months (e.g. 3M) or years (e.g. 1Y)
The maximal age of the addon. Value has to be a dedicated number of months (e.g. 3M) or years (e.g. 1Y)
If set to 1 additional statistics will be displayed
You can specify additional properties to be returned. Only allowed value is PRICE
